verb.description: Walk with difficulty, typically because of a damaged or stiff leg or foot.
examples: he limped heavily as he moved
he limped off during Saturday's game
the conversation limped on for half an hour

noun.description: A tendency to limp; a gait impeded by injury or stiffness.

adjective.description: Lacking internal strength or structure; not stiff or firm.
examples: she let her whole body go limp
the flags hung limp and still

origin: Early 18th century: of unknown origin; perhaps related to limp, having the basic sense hanging loose.
